Quizno's: Fast Food Franchise Review for North Oklahoma City
Quizno's: Fast Food Franchise Review for North Oklahoma City Deborah Oakes, NPS , Yahoo! Contributor Network May 31, 2009 "Share your voice on Yahoo! websites. Start Here ." More: Fast Food Franchising quizno's Flag Close Post a comment Quizno's Neighborhood: Quail Springs Oklahoma City , OK 73134 United States of America Quizno's: Fast Food Franchise Review for North Oklahoma City It had been several years since I dined at Quizno's because I didn't care for their greasy sandwiches. Since I had Quiznos coupons, I decided to try their new Torpedo Sub sandwiches. Find out here how this fast food franchise stacks up.
Quizno's: Fast Food Franchise Review for North Oklahoma City
It was late one evening and I didn't feel like fixing dinner. I remembered my Quiznos coupons, so I decided to try their new Torpedo Sub sandwiches since I know Quizno's offers a sandwich bar . I called the store to make sure of the location. Unfortunately, the employee gave me ridiculous directions but I finally found it.
I entered the fast food franchise and walked to the counter where three employees and a manager stood to greet me. The next thing I knew, I was hurried through my ordering although I was the only customer there. The manager made things worse because she was trying to do two things at once. She trained an employee as she helped the employee helping me.
Anyway, we finally got things figured out and I proceeded to the sandwich bar while they prepared my sub sandwiches. I really like the offerings at the sandwich bar. There is wine vinaigrette dressing, creamy horseradish, pickles, jalapeños, banana peppers, bar-b-que sauce and napkins.
Individual plastic cups with lids are available for condiments. I am delighted Quizno's offers SoBe drinks. These are available at health food stores so I feel good about drinking one. My sub sandwiches were finished just about the same time the condiments were ready.
I ordered a Turkey Pesto Torpedo sub sandwich. I thought there should be a little more meat but with the condiments, it tasted good. Except, I could taste the grease the bun is warmed with and I still don't care for the taste.
After all these years, I hoped Quizno's sub sanwiches would taste good again. I'll have to remember to ask for a plain bun, no heating it up. The tomato basil soup is good although I won't order it again. I noticed their menu had details about healthy fast food, so I'll give this Quizno's fast food franchise an 8 out of 10 points.
Click here for a review of McDonald's one block North.
Quizno's at Quail Springs Market Place 2150 W. Memorial Rd. OKC, OK 73134 405.751.4700
Source: Author's Experience: Fast Food Franchise, Quizno's
Quizno's: Fast Food Franchise Review for North Oklahoma City copyright 2009.
Published by Deborah Oakes, NPS
Certified National Product Specialist, Author: "H1N1 Threat Reduced Using Natural Healthcare" and "Home&Hearth Recipes." View profile

9 Comments Post a Comment Cathy A Montville 6/6/2009 We finally have a Quiznos here, well about a half-hour away, and I go there every now and then and love their food! The service is decent as well! jayanti raman 6/5/2009 Great work,thanks Typing for Food Jennifer Wagner 6/3/2009 I really love Quiznos. I know it's just a sub, but it tastes better than other places. Dina Quirion 6/3/2009 I agree with Jennifer, LOL. That commercial cracks me up... :o) Jennifer Waite 6/2/2009 Sounds yummy! I just can't get past the commercial! "Put it in me, Scott!" Dan Reveal 6/2/2009 Thanks for this review about Quizno's. I keep seeing their commercials about great-looking food.. Kofi Bofah 6/1/2009 What in the world was going on with you on 5/31? You must have been really motivated around that time... Shirley Mandel 6/1/2009 This is a very honest, well written, interesting review. Quite entertaining. Hally Z. 6/1/2009 I love Quizno's, except that the stuff is usually too salty for me. It's weird that they hussled your order through like that. You may prefer Potbelly if you can't stand the grease at Quizno's.
